newsitem.title: JAPAN: S&P puts LTCB on creditwatch,negative implications.
newsitem.headline: S&P puts LTCB on creditwatch,negative implications.

text.p: Standard & Poor's Corp said on Monday it had placed the long-term and short-term debt and counterparty ratings of Long-Term Credit Bank of Japan Ltd (LTCB) on creditwatch with negative implications.
Putting LTCB on creditwatch reflects S&P's concerns about its ability to cope with ongoing deregulation and other changes in Japan's financial market, S&P said.
S&P will evaluate how the bank's lingering asset quality problems will affect its capacity to successfully compete in the transformed operating environment, S&P said.
The creditwatch action is expected to be resolved with the next month after further discussions with the bank's management, S&P said.
S&P's current rating on LTCB's senior unsecured debt is BBB+. Currently, LTCB's counterparty rating is BBB+/A2 and its certificates of deposit rating is BBB+/A2.
